column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The best collection in Chicago with touring collections only seen in NYC and Los Angeles otherwise. Pre and during Covid
column2: the Warhol exhibit showed here before anyplace. If you're an Illinois resident
column4: as there is free admission several days each month with your state ID. Also
column5: most museums in Chicago participate in the program that allows anyone on SNAP/EBT free admission every day. That doesn't include special exhibits
column6: but it's a very good deal a lot of folks don't know about. A must see if you appreciate fine art and you find yourself in Chicago. Easy location via transit. I'm unsure about parking
column7: but everything is handicapped accessable. Go!
